  • Method Details

    • verifyNumberOfTableRows

      @Then("^I see (\\d+) rows? in the (.*)$") public static void verifyNumberOfTableRows​(int expectedNumberOfRows, java.lang.String tableName) throws java.lang.Exception
      Verifies we have the expected, given number of rows in the given string representing the Table object. The string is made lower case and whitespaces are replaced with underscores, then it is sent a getNumberOfRows event and returns the number of rows in the table. The page object and driver object are defined by the WebDriverFactory and PageFactory objects. The derived Page Object (extends Page) should define a method named [element name]_[element type] returning a Table object (e.g. results_table).

      NOTE: Headers defined with a <th> tag will not be counted. If a row has a <tr> tag and a class of "header", it will be counted.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I see 10 rows in the results table
      • I see 20 rows in the User List Table
      • I see 5 rows in the Current Year Documents table
      Parameters:
      expectedNumberOfRows - int The number of rows your are expecting.
      tableName - String (Table name) This should be the name of the table element to count.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • compareTables

      @Then("^I should be shown the (\\d+)(?:st|nd|rd|th) page of results from the (.*)$") public static void compareTables​(int pageNumber, java.lang.String tableName) throws java.lang.Exception
      Compares the current page we are on with the page stored in memory given the page number and Table element object page for the current page. TODO: Add negative case

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I should be shown the 1st page of results from the members search
      • I should be shown the 2nd page of results from the teams search
      • I should be shown the 4th page of results from the pharmacy search
      Parameters:
      pageNumber - int Page we are on to use as a key to retrieve data.
      tableName - String the name of the table element on the page object
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • verifyUniqueColumnText

      @Then("^I verify the (.*?) column(s)? in the (.*?) contains? unique values$") public static void verifyUniqueColumnText​(java.lang.String columnName, java.lang.String isMultiCells, java.lang.String tableName) throws java.lang.Exception
      Verifies a column contains unique text

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the Date column in the History table contains unique values
      • I verify the Contact column in the Provider table contains unique values
      • I verify the Email column in the Employees table contains unique values
      Parameters:
      columnName - String name of the column to verify
      isMultiCells - String if table has more than 1 row
      tableName - String name of the table to search
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • verifyColumnExists

      @Then("^I verify the (.*?)( does not)? (has|have|contains?) (?:a|the) (.*?) column$") public static void verifyColumnExists​(java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String assertion, java.lang.String matchType, java.lang.String columnName) throws java.lang.Exception
      Verifies the given table contains or exactly matches or does not contain or does not exactly match the given column

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the Contact Us table contains the Phone Number column
      • I verify the Vision benefits table contains a Deductible column
      • I verify the Contact Us table does not contains the Phone Number column
      • I verify the Vision benefits table does not contains a Deductible column
      • I verify the Discography table has the Album Name column
      • I verify the Awards table has a Movie Name column
      • I verify the Discography table does not has the Album Name column
      • I verify the Awards table does not has a Movie Name column
      • I verify the College table have the Course Name column
      • I verify the Expense Report table have a Transport column
      • I verify the Lottery table does not have a Date column
      • I verify the Discography table does not have the Album Name column
      Parameters:
      tableName - String name of the table containing the column. If equal (ignore case) to "csv", we redirect to the CsvSteps.verifyColumnExists() method.
      assertion - String if null is passed, looks for match(es), if any strong value is passed, looks for the value to not exist.
      matchType - String whether we are doing an exact match or a partial match
      columnName - String name of the column to verify
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • verifyStoredTextAppearsInColumn

      @Then("^I verify the (.*?) column in the (.*?)( do(?:es)? not)? contains? the same text (?:entered|selected|used) for the (.*)$") public static void verifyStoredTextAppearsInColumn​(java.lang.String columnName, java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String assertion, java.lang.String key) throws java.lang.Exception
      Verifies a table column does or does not contain text for the stored value.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the Name column in the user info table contains the same text entered text for the username
      • I verify the Contact column in the provider info table contains the same text used for the phone number field
      • I verify the Airport Code column in the Airports table contains the same text selected for the airport's code RDU
      • I verify the Airport Code column in the Airports table does not contain the same text selected for the airport's code RDU
      Parameters:
      columnName - String Name of the column to verify
      tableName - String Name of the table containing the column
      assertion - String Assertion dictating if we are checking if the column does contain or does not contain
      key - String the key to retrieve the text to match from the configuration manager
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • verifyTextAppearsInColumn

      @Then("^I verify all the cells in the (.*?) column in the (.*?)( do(?:es)? not)? (have|has|contains?) the text (.*?)$") public static void verifyTextAppearsInColumn​(java.lang.String columnName, java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String assertion, java.lang.String matchType, java.lang.String textToMatch) throws java.lang.Exception
      Verifies all the cells in a table column does or does not contain the indicated text.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify all the cells in the Zip Code column in the Airports table contain the text 10001
      • I verify all the cells in the Store column in the Coffee Shop Table do not contain the text Roast
      Parameters:
      columnName - String Name of the column to verify
      tableName - String Name of the table containing the column
      assertion - String if null is passed, looks for match(es), if any strong value is passed, looks for the value to not exist.
      textToMatch - String the text to look for in the column
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • verifyCellInColumnHasText

      @Then("^I verify the (.*?) column in the (.*?)( does not)? (has|have|contains?) the text (.*?)$") public static void verifyCellInColumnHasText​(java.lang.String columnName, java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String assertion, java.lang.String matchType, java.lang.String textToMatch) throws java.lang.Exception
      Verifies a table column does or does not have a cell that matches the indicated text.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the Name column in the user info table has the text Bill
      • I verify the Result column in the status table does not have the text ERROR
      • I verify the Role column in the user info table contains the text Engineer
      • I verify the State column in the Provider Info Table does not contain the text North Carolina
      Parameters:
      columnName - String Name of the column to verify
      tableName - String Name of the table containing the column
      assertion - String if null is passed, looks for match(es), if any strong value is passed, looks for the value to not exist.
      matchType - String whether we are doing an exact match or a partial match
      textToMatch - String the text to look for in the column
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • verifyColumnSort

      @Then("^I verify the cells in the (.*?) column in the (.*?) are sorted in (ascending|descending) order$") public static void verifyColumnSort​(java.lang.String columnName, java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String sortOrder) throws java.lang.Exception
      Verifies a table column's values are sorted in ascending or descending order.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the cells in the First Name column in the Users Table are sorted in ascending order
      • I verify the cells in the Last Name Column in the example table are sorted in descending order
      • I verify the cells in the state column in the Address table are sorted in ascending order
      Parameters:
      columnName - String the name of the column to verify
      tableName - String the name of the table containing the column
      sortOrder - String ascending or descending
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • verifyCellInSpecifiedRowAgainstStored

      @Then("^I verify the cell in the (la|\\d+)(?:st|nd|rd|th) row and the (.*) column of the (.*?)( do(?:es)? not)? (has|have|contains?) the same text (?:entered|selected|used) for the (.*)$") public static void verifyCellInSpecifiedRowAgainstStored​(java.lang.String rowNum, java.lang.String columnName, java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String assertion, java.lang.String matchType, java.lang.String key) throws java.lang.Exception
      Verifies that a specific cell, given by the row and column, in the table contains the given previously stored text.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the cell in the last row and the Employee First Name column of the Employee table does not contain the same text used for the employee last name field
      • I verify the cell in the 2nd row and the Employee First Name column of the Employee table has the same text used for the employee first name field
      Parameters:
      rowNum - String the row number. Can be "la" to specify the last row, or an integer.
      columnName - String the name of the column to verify
      tableName - String the name of the table containing the column
      assertion - String if null is passed, looks for match(es), if any strong value is passed, looks for the value to not exist.
      matchType - String whether we are doing an exact match or a partial match
      key - String the key of the stored text to look for in the column
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • verifyCellInSpecifiedRow

      @Then("^I verify the cell in the (la|\\d+)(?:st|nd|rd|th) row and the (.*) column of the (.*?)( do(?:es)? not)? (has|have|contains?) the text (.*?)$") public static void verifyCellInSpecifiedRow​(java.lang.String rowNum, java.lang.String columnName, java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String assertion, java.lang.String matchType, java.lang.String textToMatch) throws java.lang.Exception
      Verifies that a specific cell, given by the row and column, in the table contains the given text.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the cell in the last row and the Employee First Name column of the Employee table does not contain the text Alice
      • I verify the cell in the 2nd row and the Employee First Name column of the Employee table has the text Bob
      Parameters:
      rowNum - String the row number. Can be "la" to specify the last row, or an integer.
      columnName - String the name of the column to verify
      tableName - String the name of the table containing the column
      assertion - String if null is passed, looks for match(es), if any strong value is passed, looks for the value to not exist.
      matchType - String whether we are doing an exact match or a partial match
      textToMatch - String the text to look for in the column
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • verifyColumnIsEmpty

      @Then("^I verify all cells in the (.*?) column in the (.*?) are( not)? empty$") public static void verifyColumnIsEmpty​(java.lang.String columnName, java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String assertion) throws java.lang.Exception
      Verifies all cells in the table column are or are not empty.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify all cells in the Zip Code column in the list table are not empty
      • I verify all cells in the Name column in the list table are empty
      Parameters:
      columnName - String Name of the column to verify
      tableName - String Name of the table containing the column
      assertion - String if null, checks that all cells are empty. Otherwise, checks that all cells are not empty.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • verifyColumnDisplayOrder

      @Then("^I verify the (.*?) column in the (.*?) is displayed to the left of the (.*?) column$") public static void verifyColumnDisplayOrder​(java.lang.String column1Name, java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String column2Name) throws java.lang.Exception
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • verifyStoredTextRowContainsXpath

      @Then("^I verify the row in the (.*?) with the value (?:entered|selected|used) for the (.*?)( do(?:es)? not)? contains? the xpath (.*?)$") public static void verifyStoredTextRowContainsXpath​(java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String key, java.lang.String assertion, java.lang.String xpath) throws java.lang.Exception
      Verify the element exists in row which have stored value in column name

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify row in the Project Files Table with value selected for the Search Input contains the xpath //i[contains(concat(' ', @class, ' '), ' fa-toggle-on ')]
      Parameters:
      tableName - String the name of the table element
      key - String the key used to retrieve the value
      xpath - String xpath value to element to click
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • waitForSpecificCellToHaveText

      @Then("^I wait for the cell in the (la|\\d+)(?:st|nd|rd|th) row and the (.*) column of the (.*?) to( not)? (has|have|contains?) the text (.*?)$") public static void waitForSpecificCellToHaveText​(java.lang.String rowNum, java.lang.String columnName, java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String assertion, java.lang.String matchType, java.lang.String textToMatch)
      Refreshes the page, waiting the configured time (given by the longProcessTimeout "-DlongProcessTimeout") for the table to contain the given value in the given row and column. By default, the longProcessTimeout is 60 seconds.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I wait for the cell in the 1st row and the Status column of the User table to have the text Disabled
      • I wait for the cell in the last row and the Status column of the ID table to not contain the text 123
      Parameters:
      rowNum - String row of the cell to check.
      columnName - String column of the cell to check.
      tableName - String name of the table.
      assertion - String if null is passed, looks for match(es), if any strong value is passed, looks for the value to not exist.
      matchType - String whether we are doing an exact match or a partial match.
      textToMatch - String the text to look for in the column.

    • verifyAllNumericValuesInColumn

      @Then("^I verify all values in the (.*) column in the (.*) are (less than|greater than|equal to) (.*?)$") public static void verifyAllNumericValuesInColumn​(java.lang.String columnName, java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String comparisonType, java.lang.String referenceNumber) throws java.lang.Exception
      Verifies all values in the given column are in the given state relative to the given referenceNumber, using the given comparisonType. Assumes all values in the given column are numeric, and able to be converted to double. Gherkin Examples:
      • I verify all values in the Comment column in the Example Table are less than 6.1
      • I verify all values in the Weight column in the Specimen Table are greater than 100
      • I verify all values in the Count column in the Sales Table are equal to 22
      Parameters:
      columnName - String name of the column in the table
      tableName - String name of the table element
      comparisonType - String type of comparison to perform. Options: "less than", "greater than", "equal to".
      referenceNumber - String the number to compare the column values to. Needs to be a numeric value, able to be converted to a double.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if the assertion fails or the table method throws an exception.
